intro: Orthotactus oblongus, commonly known as the broad-leaved orthotactus, is a small, perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, commonly known as the carrot or parsley family. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, elongated leaves that are usually arranged in a basal rosette. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Orthotactus oblongus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
